summary: This is an email from attorney Sabina Mariella to Judge Nathan regarding the U.S. v. Maxwell case, transmitting a sealed letter motion to quash a Rule 17(c) subpoena issued by the defendant to a third party. The communication is from the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner and is marked as confidential.

persons.name: Sabina Mariella
persons.context: Attorney at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP who is filing a letter motion to quash a subpoena on behalf of a client in the U.S. v. Maxwell case.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge (presumably Alison J. Nathan) presiding over the U.S. v. Maxwell case (20 Cr 330) to whom the motion is addressed.

connections.description: Mariella is submitting a legal motion to Judge Nathan in the U.S. v. Maxwell case.

events.title: Filing of Motion to Quash Subpoena
events.description: Attorney Sabina Mariella files a sealed letter motion to quash a Rule 17(c) subpoena issued by the defendant (Ghislaine Maxwell) to a third party in the criminal case U.S. v. Maxwell.

locations: Boies Schiller Flexner LLP (law firm office)
keyFacts: A sealed motion to quash a subpoena was filed in the U.S. v. Maxwell case on November 19, 2021.
The motion was filed by attorney Sabina Mariella of Boies Schiller Flexner LLP on behalf of an unnamed client who received a subpoena from the defense.
The document is a confidential attorney communication intended only for the named recipient (Judge Nathan).
The case referenced is U.S. v. Maxwell, 20 Cr 330 (AJN), indicating it is the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
The motion seeks to quash a Rule 17(c) subpoena, which is a subpoena for the production of documents or objects in a criminal case.
